tuv.seg: The effect of separation on each spouse's tax liability depends chiefly on whether there are any maintenance payments involved and, if so, whether these payments are made under a legally enforceable arrangement or not

Nuair a scarann pósadh braitheann an tionchar a bheidh aige ar dhliteanas cánach gach céile an bhfuil íocaíochtaí cothabhála i gceist agus, má tá, an bhfuil na híocaíochtaí seo dhá dhéanamh faoi chomhaontú dlíthiúil infheidhmithe
If maintenance payments are made, for the benefit of a spouse, under a legally enforceable arrangement during the year in which the couple separates then:
Má dhéantar íocaíochtaí cothabhála, ar mhaithe le céile amháin, faoi chomhaontú dlíthiúil infheidhmithe sa bhliain chéanna ina scarann an lánúin óna chéile, ansin:
• The spouse who makes the payments is entitled to a tax deduction for the payments
• Is féidir leis an gcéile a dhéanann na híocaíochtaí laghdú cánach a éileamh ar a son
• The spouse to whom the maintenance is paid is taxed on the payments
• Gearrtar cáin ar an gcéile a fhaigheann na híocaíochtaí
Where a couple separates and no maintenance payments are made, each spouse is taxed as a single person and is responsible for filing his/her own tax return and paying tax on his/her own income
Má scarann lánúin agus muna bhfuil aon íocaíochtaí cothabhála i gceist gearrtar cáin mar dhuine singil ar gach duine acu agus tá sé/sí freagrach as tuairisceán cánach a chomhlánú ar a s(h)on féin
Tax treatment of voluntary maintenance payments
Cáin ar íocaíochtaí cothabhála deonacha
Voluntary maintenance payments (i.e., payments that are not legally enforceable) are not taken into account when calculating either spouse's tax
Ní chuirtear íocaíochtaí cothabhála deonacha (i.e., íocaíochtaí nach féidir a chur i bhfeidhm go dlíthiúil) san áireamh nuair atá cáin ceachtar den bheirt dhá ríomh
• The spouse who makes the payments is not entitled to a tax deduction for them
• Ní féidir leis an gcéile a dhéanann na híocaíochtaí laghdú cánach a éileamh ar a son
• The spouse who receives the payments is not taxed on them
• Ní ghearrtar cáin ar an gcéile a fhaigheann na híocaíochtaí
• Both spouses are taxed on their own income as single people
• Gearrtar cáin ar an mbeirt ar a n-ioncam mar dhaoine singil
• Makes voluntary maintenance payments to the other spouse
• Dhéanann céile íocaíochtaí cothabhála deonacha leis an gcéile eile
• Is not entitled to a tax deduction for the payments because they were not made under a legally enforceable arrangement
• Muna bhfuil sé/sí in ann laghdú cánach a éileamh ar a son ós rud é nach bhfuil comhaontú dlíthiúil infheidhmithe i bhfeidhm
• The payments are sufficient to either wholly or mainly maintain his/her spouse,
• Más leor na híocaíochtaí sin lena c(h)éile a chothú go hiomlán nó don chuid is mó,
he/she will qualify for the married person's tax credit but only the single person's standard rate cut-off point is due
is féidir leis/léi creidmheas cánach an duine phósta a éileamh ach ní bheidh aige/aici ach an pointe scartha don ráta caighdeánach don duine singil
The other spouse can also claim the single person's tax credit against his/her own income (if any)
Is féidir leis an gcéile eile freisin éileamh a dhéanamh ar chreidmheas cánach an duine singil ar a (h)ioncam, más ann dó
"Mainly Maintaining" means that the payer's maintenance payments exceed the recipient's income
Ciallaíonn "Cothabháil don chuid is mó" gur mó é suim na n-íocaíochtaí cothabhála ná ioncam an fhaighteora
Legally enforceable maintenance arrangements
Comhaontuithe Cothabhála Dlíthiúla Infheidhmithe

Legally enforceable maintenance arrangements include annual or periodic maintenance payments made under an order of court, deed of separation, rule of court, trust, covenant or any other act that gives rise to a legally enforceable obligation

I measc na gcomhaontaithe cothabhála dlíthiúla infheidhmithe tá íocaíochtaí bliantúla nó tréimhsiúla a dhéantar faoi ordú cúirte, gníomhas scartha, rialú cúirte, iontaobhas, cúnant nó aon ghníomh eile atá ina cheangal infheidhmhithe dlíthiúil
The maintenance arrangement must be made or carried out in consideration or in consequence of a separation
Ní mór go mbeadh an comhaontú cothabhála déanta nó curtha i gcrích ar mhaithe le nó mar gheall ar phósadh a scaradh
Maintenance payments that are made under a legally enforceable arrangement entered into on or after 8 June 1983 are payable without deduction of tax
Tá íocaíochtaí cothabhála a dhéantar faoi chomhaontú dlíthiúil infheidhmithe a rinneadh ar nó i ndiaidh an 8 Meitheamh 1983 iníoctha gan cáin a asbhaint
The following rules apply to maintenance payments made for the benefit of a spouse:
Baineann na rialacha seo a leanas le híocaíochtaí cothabhála a dhéantar ar mhaithe le céile:
• The payments are made without deduction of tax (gross)
• Go ndéantar na híocaíochtaí gan aon cháin a bhaint astu (comhlán)
• The spouse who makes the payments is entitled to a tax deduction for them
• Go bhfuil an céile a dhéanann na híocaíochtaí i dteideal éilimh a dhéanamh ar laghdú cánach ar a son
• The spouse who receives the maintenance payments is liable for tax on them
• Go bhfuil cáin le n-íoc orthu ag an gcéile a fhaigheann na híocaíochtaí cothabhála
• Both spouses are taxed as single people (unless they choose to be taxed as a married couple)
• Gearrtar cáin mar dhaoine singil ar an mbeirt (ach amháin sa chás go mbíonn siad ag iarraidh cáin a íoc mar lánúin phósta)
A separated couple can choose to be treated as a married couple for income tax purposes if:
Is féidir le lánúin atá scartha cinneadh a dhéanamh cáin ioncaim a íoc mar lánúin phósta:
• They are both resident in the State
• Má tá an bheirt acu ina gcónaí sa Stát
• Maintenance payments are made under a legally enforceable arrangement
• Má tá na híocaíochtaí cothabhála dhá ndéanamh faoi chomhaontú dlíthiúil
The couple must submit a joint election in writing if they wish to avail of this option
Ní mór don lánúin iarratas scríofa a dhéanamh lena chéile más mian leo an rogha seo a thógáil
The election must be made in writing before the end of the tax year and must be signed by both parties
Ní mór an cinneadh seo a dhéanamh roimh dheireadh na bliana cánach agus ní mór don bheirt acu an t-iarratas a shíniú

If such an election is made, the maintenance payments are ignored, i.e., the spouse making the payments does not get a tax deduction for them and the spouse who receives the payments is not liable for tax on them

Má dhéantar an rogha seo déantar neamhaird de na híocaíochtaí cothabhála, i.e., ní fhaigheann an céile a dhéanann na híocaíochtaí laghdú cánach ar a son agus ní íocann an céile a fhaigheann na híocaíochtaí aon cháin orthu

Where both spouses possess income, separate assessment will apply, i.e., tax credits and standard rate cut-off point will be apportioned between the spouses, subject to a review at the end of the year to ensure that any unused tax credit or relevant rate bands are given to the other spouse

Má tá ioncam ag an mbeirt gearrfar cáin orthu faoi mheasúnú ar leith, i.e., roinnfear creidmheasanna cánacha agus an pointe scartha don ráta caighdeánach idir an bheirt acu, déanfar athbhreithniú ar seo ag deireadh na bliana le déanamh cinnte go bhfuil an céile eile in ann leas a bhaint as aon chreidmheas cánach nár úsáideadh nó as aon bhandaí cánacha cuí
Where only one spouse has income, the full tax credits, reliefs and the maximum standard rate cut-off point (for couples with one spouse working) will be given to that spouse

Muna bhfuil ioncam ach ag céile amháin tabharfar na creidmheasanna cánacha iomlán, na faoisimh agus an t-uasmhéid den phointe scartha don ráta caighdeánach don chéile sin (iad siúd atá ar fáil do lánúin le céile amháin ag obair)
For details and examples of the different types of assessment see Taxation of married people and civil partners in Ireland
Tá sonraí agus samplaí de na cineálacha éagsúla measúnaithe ar fáil anseo
Maintenance payments that are made for the benefit of a child or children are ignored for tax purposes:
Déantar neamhaird ar íocaíochtaí cothabhála a dhéantar ar mhaithe le páiste nó páistí ó thaobh cúrsaí cánacha:
• The payments are made without deduction of tax (gross)
• Déantar na híocaíochtaí gan aon cháin a bhaint (comhlán)
• The person making the payments is not entitled to a tax deduction for the payments
• Níl an té a dhéanann na híocaíochtaí i dteideal laghdú ó cháin a fháil ar a son
• The payments are not taxable
• Níl cáin le n-íoc ar na híocaíochtaí
• The payments are not regarded as income of the child
• Ní chuirtear na híocaíochtaí san áireamh mar ioncam an pháiste

A primary claimant can surrender his or her entitlement to the credit, in favour of a secondary claimant (provided the child (or children) lives with that person for more than 100 days in a year and the person meets all the other qualifying conditions.)

D'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh gach céile in ann éileamh a dhéanamh ar Chreidmheas Cánach ar Pháiste faoi Mhíchumas (féach ar Bileog IT18 (pdf)) agus/nó Creidmheas Cánach do Theaghlach Aontuismitheora (pdf)
If you are receiving maintenance payments and you also have income that is subject to PAYE, it may be possible to collect some or all of the tax due on the maintenance by reducing your tax credits

Má tá tú ag fáil íocaíochtaí cothabhála agus má tá ioncam a bhaineann leis an gcóras ÍMAT agat freisin d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh tú in ann iomlán nó cuid den cháin atá dlite a íoc faoin gcóras sin tríd do chreidmheasanna cánacha a laghdú
If you are receiving maintenance payments only, the tax due is payable directly in one lump sum under the self assessment procedures
Muna bhfuil d'ioncam agat ach na híocaíochtaí cothabhála gearrfar an cháin ort faoin gcóras féin-mheasúnaithe in aon chnapshuim amháin
In calculating your finances, you should take into account the payment of any tax that is due and the fact that this amount may have to be paid in one lump sum
Nuair atá tú ag ríomh do chuid cúrsaí airgeadais ba cheart duit a chur san áireamh aon cháin atá le n-íoc agat agus smaoineamh go mba fhéidir go mbeidh ort í sin a íoc ina cnapshuim amháin
Where a couple obtain an Irish divorce, the provisions as outlined above will apply to any maintenance arrangements made by order of the court, which means that:
Nuair a bhíonn colscaradh Éireannach ag lánúin beidh na soláthair thuasluaite i bhfeidhm maidir le haon íocaíochtaí cothabhála a ordaíonn an Chúirt, rud a chiallaíonn:
• Maintenance payments are made without deduction of tax
• Go ndéantar íocaíochtaí cothabhála gan cáin a bhaint astu
• The spouse who makes the payments is entitled to a tax deduction for them
• Go bhfuil an céile a dhéanann na híocaíochtaí i dteideal éilimh a dhéanamh ar laghdú cánach ar a son
• The spouse who receives the maintenance is taxable on the payments
• Go bhfuil cáin le n-íoc orthu ag an gcéile a fhaigheann na híocaíochtaí cothabhála
• Both spouses are taxed as single persons
• Gearrtar cáin mar dhaoine singil ar an mbeirt
A divorced couple also has the option of being treated as a married couple (the separate assessment provisions will apply) for income tax purposes if:
Is féidir le lánúin colscartha rogha a dhéanamh cáin a íoc mar lánúin phósta (bainfidh na rialacha faoin measúnú faoi leith leo) ar a n-ioncam:
• They are both resident in the State
• Má tá an bheirt acu ina gcónaí sa Stát
• Neither spouse has remarried
• Muna bhfuil ceachtar acu athphósta
If a marriage is annulled, each spouse will be taxed as a single person from the date of the annullment onwards
Má dhéantar pósadh a chur ar neamhní gearrfar cáin ar gach duine den bheirt mar dhuine singil ón dáta sin ar aghaidh
The couple cannot make an election for joint assessment
Ní féidir leis an lánúin iarratas a dhéanamh ar chomh-mheasúnú
Visit the Revenue contact locator webpage to find the Lo-call number for your region
Uimhreacha ló-ghlaoch teileafóin do oifigí réigiúnach na gCoimisinéirí Ioncaim ar fáil anseo
You can find more detailed contact details for your region here
Is féidir leat a thuilleadh eolais a fháil faoi shonraí teagmhála do do réigiún anseo
